meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a thing.
meanings.sent1: The thingnesses of the rock made it feel solid and real.
meanings.sent2: She admired the thingnesses of the painting, appreciating its form and color.
meanings.sent3: The thingnesses of the toy car made it seem almost alive.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, the thingnesses of the forest took on a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The thingnesses of the old book brought back memories of childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: The collective qualities or characteristics that make something a thing.
meanings.sent1: The thingnesses of the recipe included fresh ingredients and careful preparation.
meanings.sent2: As an artist, she focused on capturing the thingnesses of everyday objects in her paintings.
meanings.sent3: The thingnesses of the jigsaw puzzle pieces made them fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His poetry delved into the thingnesses of human emotions, exploring their depths.
meanings.sent5: The thingnesses of the flower garden filled the air with a sweet fragrance.
